required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunotherapy of Cervical Cancer With V3-Cervix
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label Single Arm Phase II Immunotherapy Trial in Patients With Cervical Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this trial is to evaluate the efficacy of immunotherapy for cervical cancer based on a fundamentally new approach. We will test new tableted preparation, V3-Cervix, obtained from hydrolyzed, inactivated blood and tumors of patients with cervical cancer. When administered orally, it should cause a specific anti-tumor immune response and an anti-inflammatory effect. Trial is planned to last 3 months, recruit 20 volunteers, administer daily pill of vaccine and evaluate effect on tumor size and tumor markers.

detailed_description.textblock: Cervical cancer (CC) is a malignant neoplasm that occurs in the cervix. Histologically, there are two main types: adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. Cervical cancer is most common in middle-aged women (35-55 years of age), in 20% of cases it is found over the age of 65 years. Cancer of the body and cervix are the most common type of malignant tumor of female genital organs. It is believed that human papillomavirus (HPV) is the main risk factor causing cervical cancer. Cervical cancer combines surgical treatment, radiotherapy and chemotherapy. Current immunotherapies did not show much success. The prognosis depends on the stage of the disease: 5-year survival rate at the first stage is 78.1%, at the second stage - 57%, at the third - 31%, at the fourth - 7.8%. There is no specific cervical cancer marker, usually a panel of markers is used including CA125, beta-hCG, CEA, SCC, CA19.9 and CA27.29. The goal of this trial is to evaluate the efficacy of immunotherapy for cervical cancer based on a fundamentally new approach. We will test new tableted preparation, V3-Cervix, obtained from hydrolyzed, inactivated blood and tumors of patients with cervical cancer. When administered orally, it should cause a specific anti-tumor immune response and an anti-inflammatory effect. Trial is planned to last 3 months, recruit 20 volunteers, administer daily pill of vaccine and evaluate effect on tumor size and tumor markers.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Single group assignment to receive one pill of vaccine once per day for 3 months

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in tumor size and burden compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Intravaginal ultrasonography of lower abdomen to measure changes

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on baseline tumor markers, if any
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum levels of a panel of tumor markers such as CA125, beta-hCG, CEA, SCC, СА19.9 and СА27.29 compared to baseline

arm_group.description: Biological: V3-Cervix V3-Cervix is a tableted immunotherapeutic derived from hydrolyzed, heat-inactivated, pooled blood and tumor tissue from women with cervical cancer

intervention.description: Oral tableted preparation containing hydrolyzed tumor antigens derived from peripheral blood and tumor tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
confirmed diagnosis of cervical cancer available baseline measurement of tumor size and burden presence of tumor markers associated with cervical cancer, i.e., CA125, beta-hCG, CEA, SCC, СА19.9 and СА27.29 -
Exclusion Criteria:
metastases to other sites hysterectomy
-

eligibility.gender_description: This particular condition, i.e., cervical cancer, is gender specific as it is found in females only

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available upon study conclusion
